channel.title: Tech Velocity: PC Hardware, AI, & China Silicon News (Aggregated)
channel.description: Comprehensive daily news covering the latest in PC hardware, AI co-processors, Chinese silicon developments (Moore Threads, Loongson), and links to top external tech news feeds.

item.title: Top Recommended External Tech News Feeds (Real URLs)
item.description:
This is a direct list of the main RSS feed links for major tech publications. Copy these URLs directly into your feed reader:

  • WCCFtech (Main Feed): https://wccftech.com/feed
  • Tom's Hardware (Latest News): https://www.tomshardware.com/feeds/latest
  • TechRadar (Main Feed): https://www.techradar.com/feeds.xml
  • Pandaily (China Tech News): https://pandaily.com/feed/
  • AnandTech (Main Feed): https://www.anandtech.com/feed/
  • The Verge (All Posts): https://www.theverge.com/rss/index.xml

item.title: Intel 18A CPU Process Nearing Volume Production Milestone for Arrow Lake
item.description: Intelâ€™s next-generation manufacturing node, 18A, is reportedly meeting key quality and yield targets, signaling readiness for volume production of future desktop and mobile Arrow Lake CPUs. This process promises significant leaps in power efficiency, critical for next-gen AI PC designs and NPU performance scaling.

item.title: AMD Ryzen 9000 Series Desktop Processors Officially Launch Q1 2026
item.description: AMD officially confirmed that the highly anticipated Ryzen 9000 series desktop CPUs, based on the **Zen 5** architecture, are set for an early Q1 2026 launch. Benchmarks show IPC improvements of over 15% across the stack, solidifying the fight for desktop performance dominance against Intel's new process nodes.

item.title: NVIDIA Hopper Next-Gen GPU Rumors Point to HBM4 Memory Integration
item.description: Industry leaks suggest NVIDIA is aggressively pursuing **HBM4 memory** for its next-generation data center GPU architecture (codenamed "Hopper Next"). This move is essential to satisfy the extreme bandwidth demands of training multi-trillion parameter **LLMs** (Large Language Models), further separating data center hardware from consumer cards.

item.title: Windows AI Explorer Requires 45+ TOPS NPU for Full Feature Set
item.description: Microsoft documentation updates indicate that the flagship features of the Windows AI Explorer environment, particularly advanced local recall and multimodal AI processing, will require a Neural Processing Unit (NPU) capable of **45 TOPS** or greater. This effectively mandates the use of next-gen mobile platforms from Intel and AMD.

item.title: Moore Threads MTT S4000 GPU Targets Mid-Range Cloud Gaming Market in China
item.description: Moore Threads, a key domestic GPU player in China, has unveiled the MTT S4000, positioning it as a robust solution for the rapidly expanding Chinese **cloud gaming** and rendering market. The card features optimized drivers specifically tailored for popular domestic game engines and high-efficiency video encoding standards.

item.title: QLC NAND Endurance Jumps 30%, Making 8TB+ SSDs Mainstream
item.description: New controller and firmware techniques have allowed major NAND manufacturers to boost the guaranteed write endurance (TBW) of **QLC (Quad-Level Cell)** SSDs by nearly 30%. This development eliminates a major consumer concern and is expected to push 8TB and 16TB drives into the mainstream desktop storage market by year-end.

item.title: Loongson's 3A6000 Gains Linux Kernel 6.7 Optimization, Boosting I/O Performance
item.description: The LoongArch architecture used by Loongson CPUs has received significant upstream optimization in the new Linux 6.7 kernel release. Key improvements focus on memory management and **I/O performance**, providing a major boost to enterprise and server stability for the domestically developed platform.
